transliteration: Bhanadg Bhachhant|| Kaadhhikachhant|| Kingribajant|| Bhagvat Anant||401||
translation: He used to drink hemp, roamed here and there blew his horn and remained absorbed in the meditation of the Lord.401.

gurmukhi: nhI fulq lMg ]muin mn ABMg ]juit jog jMg ]ijm aufq cMg ]402]
transliteration: Nahidulat An|| Mounndi) Man Abhan|| Jouttee Jog Jan|| Jim Udat Channd||402||
translation: His limbs and mind both remained stable; absorbed in meditation, he remained engrossed in the practice of Yoga.402.

gurmukhi: nhI krq hwie ]qp krq cwie ]inqpRiq bnwie ]bhu Bgq Bwie ]403]
transliteration: Nahikarat Haae|| Tap Karat Chaae|| Nitprat(i) Banaae|| Bahu Bhagad Bhaae||403||
translation: While performing austerities, he never felt any suffering; and being absorbed in various types of devotional ideas, he always remained engrossed in devotion.403.

gurmukhi: muK BCq paun ]qij Dwm gaun ]mun rhq maun ]suB rwj Baun ]404]
transliteration: Moukh Bhachhat Paoun|| Taj(i) Dhaam Gaddd|| Mounndrahat Maoun|| Soubh Raaj Bhaoun||404||
translation: These sages, who relinquished their homes, subsisted on air and remained silent.404.

gurmukhi: sMnXws dyv ]mun mn AByv ]An juir Ajyv ]AMqir Aqyv ]405]
transliteration: Sannyaas Dev|| Mounndman Abhev|| An Jur(i) Ajev|| Antar(i) Atev||405||
translation: These sages, supreme amongst Sannyasis understood the internal mysteries; they were the age with mysterious mind.405.

gurmukhi: An BU pRkwS ]inq pRiq audws ]gun AiDk jws ]lK ljq Anws ]406]
transliteration: An Bhoo Prakaadh|| Nit Prat(i) Udaas|| Goun Adhik Jaas|| Lakh Lajat Anaas||406||
translation: They felt the inner Light and remained detached; they were full of virues and were no prone to destruction.406.

gurmukhi: bHmMn dyv ]gun gn AByv ]dyvwn dyv ]AniBK Ajyv ]407]
transliteration: Brahmann Dev|| Goun Gad Abhev|| Devaan Dev|| Anbhikh Ajev||407||
translation: They were adorable for Brahmins, and masters of mysterious qualities; they were god of gods, who never begged alms etc.407.

gurmukhi: sMinAws nwQ ]An Dr pRmwQ ]iek rtq gwQ ]iek tyk swQ 408 ]
transliteration: Sanniaas Naath|| An Dhar Pramaath|| Ik Ratat Gadth|| Ik Tek Saath||408||
translation: They were masters of Sannyasis and supremely mighty people; someone talked about their story and someone walked with them.408.

gurmukhi: gun gin Apwr ]muin min audwr ]suB miq suFwr ]buiD ko phwr ]409]
transliteration: Goun Gad(i) Apaar|| Mounndi) Man(i) Udaar|| Soubh Mat(i) Sudhaar|| Budh(i) Ko Pahaar|| 409||
translation: These gentle sages were masters of infinite qualities; they were persons of good intellect and stores of wisdom..409.

gurmukhi: sMinAws ByK ]Ain ibK Ad√çYK ]jwpq AByK ]biRD buiD AlyK ]410]
transliteration: Sanniaas Bhekh|| An(i) Bikh Advekh|| Jaapat Abhekh|| Bridh Budh(i) Alekh||410||
translation: These sages in the garb of Sannyasis, were without malice and remembering that Lord, were merged (absorbed) in that Great, wise and unrealizable Lord.410.

gurmukhi: DM Dikq ieMd ]cM cikq cMd ]QM Qkq paun ]BM Bjq maun ]411]
transliteration: Dhan Dhakit Ind|| Channdchakit Channd|| Than Thakat Paoun|| Bhan Bhajat Maoun||411||
translation: Indra, moon-god and wind-god silently remembered the Lord.411.

gurmukhi: jM jikq j`C ]pM pcq p`C ]DM Dkq isMD ]bM bkq ibMD ]412]
transliteration: Jan Jakit Jachchh|| Pan Pachat Pachchh|| Dhan Dhakat Sindh|| Ban Bakat Bindh||412||
translation: The Yakshas, birds and oceans wer raising tumult in astonishment.412.

gurmukhi: sM skq isMD ]gM gkq igMD ]qM qkq dyv ]AM Aikq Byv ]413]
transliteration: San Sakat Sindh|| Gad Gadat Gindh|| Tan Takat Dev|| An Akit Bhev||413||
translation: The sea alongwith his powers was visualizing that God of gods and mysterious Lord.413.
